alert.note: Alert for San Gorgonio Pass Near Banning (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 13 at 1:02PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following areas, Riverside County Mountains, San Bernardino County Mountains and San Gorgonio Pass Near Banning. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An atmospheric river producing periods of moderate to heavy rain at high elevations on a snowpack will lead to increasing melting and runoff. Flows in rivers and streams may increase quickly and reach critical levels. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
